Comments_List: This course taught me to structure a question about a text data set and apply a broad set of tools in answering that question. It's a great, highly interactive introduction to the methods used to analyze text data.

- Understanding of Python for text analysis
- Understanding key concepts of natural language processing
- First hand experience in understanding the challenge of data wrangling
An understanding of topic models and word embeddings and other interesting ways to visualize and assess text data.

The course was great overall. It might be helpful to have more pre-readings/conceptual framing in advance of the labs. I would also recommend cultivating more discussion early in the semester, and even doing part of the class without laptops before diving into the labs. More collaborative coding would also be welcome.

Strengths
- Great labs
- Great conceptual introduction and explanations

Weaknesses
- Trouble in terms of logistics of Kernel (frequent shutdown/restarts due to insufficient memories)

Amazing professor with a contagious passion for the subject. Neat, interesting lab exercises. It was fun to uncover insights on bias in text through the final exam. The only improvement I can think of is for canvas links to be posted early for homework submissions.
Yes, this class is great for anybody wanting to learn about harvesting the big data of texts!
Yes, it was the best course I took my spring semester.
